posts.body: Second attempt at making sure I did the new certification correctly...

>>dd986263-fabd-485f-815b-bfd3019f5d18

...then couldn't we just update the site to not show usernames? Individual users can obviously work around that if they want to see usernames, but the general user isn't going to want to do so (and probably isn't going to have the tech knowhow to do it anyway).

>>43811a32-706b-4231-91b5-08a124f52b75
When I switched to using the zeroid, I had to go and re-blacklist all of the boards that I had previously blacklisted.

I don't know if I would have had to remute people, because I didn't have anyone muted.

>>c1f51d04-23e3-4b10-b0dc-e630e74dbe0c
Yes, I could do that, but that's going to require every user to update their CSS if they want to hide the usernames. I'm saying the site itself should hide it automatically. That way anyone who wants to see them can, and everyone else is automatically set not to see them.

Like the other guy said I would prefer no one be able to see them anyway, but having the default option be for them to be hidden would be nearly as good.

>>ed86ed13-a6c2-4fc2-b55b-f734c4cfd47b
You make some good points. There is also ZeroUp, though, from the main ZeroNet homepage.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/?Popular

That could possibly be useful as another backup. You do still run into a similar issue of a smaller seed base, but a backup never hurts.

>>dd27811b-10b9-4ccd-9d28-411aa0c4c94c
1) Find your original ID hash. You can find your ID hash by dragging the ZeroNet icon to the left.

2) Go to your ZeroNet data directory and search for the folder with your ID.

3) Inside that folder, you'll find a file named "blacklist.json" and "blacklist.json-old"

4) Presumably, you can just copy and paste those files into the folder for your new ID and they would take place...I'm not sure, when you next reload the page or restart ZeroNet? Not sure. I just manually blacklisted them all again.

First, why aren't you using a VPN?

Second...so what? Are you doing anything illegal here?
Just making sure my image goes through. I've tested posting, but I haven't yet tested posting an image.

>>0c4880d7-fd81-4975-8291-b426b2df6e64
Nope, not loading. I see the thumbnail but no main image, and it says no one is seeding it.

Restesting >>a1d15cc4-085e-44c5-b99c-68120e2d76d8

>>b472a92b-7eac-493b-becf-6ee405443f49
I still only get just the thumbnail, but other people seem to be getting the entire picture so that probably means it's just an issue on my end somehow.

>>ce68d641-83a6-4c5b-86d5-32a3d7242eca
Okay, great, I can finally post again. I had that "Processing post...please wait" issue for fucking hours. I went through the steps in >>dc58bef2-f43f-41e3-ab1a-b5f2cfd0d681 and now this works, although the look of the site is completely fucked now.

Hopefully I can post images, too...?

>>265b221f-4bac-4159-9372-2b9368fa60ac
Great! Thanks for confirming.

Now if anyone can just direct me to where I can edit the css choices, I'll be done. I preferred the nullchan.css and I still have it, but the only two options I have now are dark.css and light.css and I think both look like ass. I just want to be able to add the nullchan.css to the list.

>>df43bcd5-bace-4e53-801b-3390b5387e33
Yup, and the full image even loads completely.

>>fca9dbc1-c536-4311-8225-4cb785171ff4
>>bd116c4f-2da3-45bb-b666-ad146c895e7f
What is >>7bb71eee-0951-485d-bd68-a6141bf44a42b2e31f1b2e? Now I'm paranoid I'm missing posts or something.

Edit:
Also, the pin option is now gone on the main 08chan page. Any way to pin boards now?

>>4abbb34e-e1d1-4d6e-ab7f-dbade3499a83
You seem in the know. Is there a way to set ZeroNet to automatically seed all the files that I view unless I specifically mute them?

I don't want to download and seed everything from all of 08chan, that seems like, one, a massive waste of my space and, two, a massive chance of seeding something that I really don't want to seed. But I wouldn't mind automatically seeding every image/file I view within the boards that I visit.

As you said near the end, the real fun for me is building the character and seeing how much I can either cheese the system or make him a fucking god and steamroll every encounter. For instance, a thief character using stealth and abusing Wand of Cloudkill. Mildly amusing for a while.

Most often CRPGs are praised more for their story, not their combat systems. That's the case with Planescape: Torment, either KotOR game, and Mask of the Betrayer. The way I've always seen it is that the combat systems in these games are designed to be akin to puzzles. You either enjoy puzzles or you don't, but even if you enjoy them I think most people would be unlikely to say that they're "fun." And I say this as someone who by and large loves the CRPG genre.

Underrail got a ton of praise at 8chan. I think Age of Decadence got some mentions too, but that was more mixed. Those are two more modern CRPGs you can look into. I haven't played either, though, so I can't recommend one or the other.

I deleted the site and redownloaded it again and now I'm just testing to make sure I can post again.

Edit: Okay, great. Now if I can just get these fucking failed files to download.

Anyone know how to get a refund from Good Old Games?

Entirely unrelated to this thread, I assure you.
Question about the "Seed small files" and "Seed big files" options from the board list on the main page: is it possible to ''stop'' seeding after I've started? There's no option for that.
